update.description:
Two new tools added to the gui

**Align**

1. in Arrow mode,  select a model with the mouse

2. Ctrl + Left Click to select more models (the last one selected will be used as the basis of alignment)

3. Click on the align icon and choose an align configuration

**Snap**

1. Click on the snap icon

2. Click on a face of a model to select a triangle on its mesh

3. Click on a face of another model to snap the first model to it.

Sorry for the long pull request

Fixes issue #1256
update.title: GUI Align and Snap tools

content.raw:
It happens for me too on trusty, though I sometimes get the following message as well:
~~~
QWARN  : ModelSnap_TEST::Snap() QObject::connect: Cannot connect (null)::DeleteSignal(const std::string &) to gazebo::gui::ModelCreator::OnDelete(const std::string &)
FAIL!  : ModelSnap_TEST::Snap() 'gazebo::math::equal(model03Vis->GetWorldPose().pos.x, model02Vis->GetWorldPose().pos.x + 1.0, 1e-2)' returned FALSE. ()
   Loc: [/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/ModelSnap_TEST.cc(103)]
~~~
I also get the message that Nate listed.
content.html:
It happens for me too on trusty, though I sometimes get the following message as well:

QWARN  : ModelSnap_TEST::Snap() QObject::connect: Cannot connect (null)::DeleteSignal(const std::string &) to gazebo::gui::ModelCreator::OnDelete(const std::string &)
FAIL!  : ModelSnap_TEST::Snap() 'gazebo::math::equal(model03Vis->GetWorldPose().pos.x, model02Vis->GetWorldPose().pos.x + 1.0, 1e-2)' returned FALSE. ()
   Loc: [/home/scpeters/ws/gazebo/src/gazebo/gazebo/gui/ModelSnap_TEST.cc(103)]

I also get the message that Nate listed.

content.raw: Good catch, it only runs if `ENABLE_SCREEN_TESTS` is true.
content.html: Good catch, it only runs if ENABLE_SCREEN_TESTS is true.

content.raw: The modelsnap test did not run.
content.html: The modelsnap test did not run.

content.raw: It happens every time.
content.html: It happens every time.

content.html: it didn't fail in the most recent jenkins run

content.raw:
Started new thread for `UNIT_ModelAlign_TEST` failures. The test now only fails occasionally (~20% of time). From a backtrace, it seems to fail during teardown of the test:
~~~
********* Start testing of ModelAlign_TEST *********
Config: Using QTest library 4.8.6, Qt 4.8.6
PASS   : ModelAlign_TEST::initTestCase()
SharePercentChange[0.554668] ShareMaxPercentChange[2]
ResPercentChange[1.49914]ResMaxPercentChange[5]
PASS   : ModelAlign_TEST::AlignXMin()
SharePercentChange[0.0142315] ShareMaxPercentChange[2]
ResPercentChange[0.245765]ResMaxPercentChange[5]
PASS   : ModelAlign_TEST::AlignXCenter()
SharePercentChange[0.0110047] ShareMaxPercentChange[2]
ResPercentChange[0.184843]ResMaxPercentChange[5]
PASS   : ModelAlign_TEST::AlignXMax()
QFATAL : ModelAlign_TEST::AlignYMin() Received signal 11
FAIL!  : ModelAlign_TEST::AlignYMin() Received a fatal error.
   Loc: [Unknown file(0)]
Totals: 4 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of ModelAlign_TEST *********
Aborted (core dumped)
~~~

content.raw:
I'm getting seg-faults since this change when I try to resize an object.
~~~
$ gazebo
gzclient: /usr/include/OGRE/OgreAxisAlignedBox.h:510: void Ogre::AxisAlignedBox::transformAffine(const Ogre::Matrix4&): Assertion `m.isAffine()' failed.
~~~

[backtrace here](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/ccb655ea8a80bf75d577)

content.raw:
[Test failure in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo-gpu/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/98/testReport/junit/%28root%29/ModelAlign_TEST/AlignXMin/); I can reproduce it on my machine too:
~~~
$ gazebo/gui/UNIT_ModelAlign_TEST 
********* Start testing of ModelAlign_TEST *********
Config: Using QTest library 4.8.6, Qt 4.8.6
PASS   : ModelAlign_TEST::initTestCase()
FAIL!  : ModelAlign_TEST::AlignXMin() Caught unhandled exception
   Loc: [qtestcase.cpp(1927)]
Totals: 1 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of ModelAlign_TEST *********
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'gazebo::common::Exception'
Aborted (core dumped)
~~~

The backtrace isn't so interesting:
~~~
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007f9d42552f79 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
#1  0x00007f9d42556388 in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x00007f9d42b586b5 in __gnu_cxx::__verbose_terminate_handler() () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007f9d42b56836 in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#4  0x00007f9d42b56863 in std::terminate() () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007f9d42b56af6 in __cxa_rethrow () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#6  0x00007f9d4461aed1 in QTest::qExec(QObject*, int, char**) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtTest.so.4
#7  0x0000000000407765 in main (argc=1, argv=0x7fff029fc338) at gazebo/gui/ModelAlign_TEST.cc:713
(gdb)
~~~
content.html:

$ gazebo/gui/UNIT_ModelAlign_TEST 
********* Start testing of ModelAlign_TEST *********

Totals: 1 passed, 1 failed, 0 skipped
********* Finished testing of ModelAlign_TEST *********
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'gazebo::common::Exception'

The backtrace isn't so interesting:

content.raw: fixed, 61dcee7
content.html: fixed, 61dcee7

update.description:
Two new tools added to the gui

**Align**

1. in Arrow mode,  select a model with the mouse

2. Ctrl + Left Click to select more models (the last one selected will be used as the basis of alignment)

3. Click on the align icon and choose an align configuration

**Snap**

1. Click on the snap icon

2. Click on a face of a model to select a triangle on its mesh

3. Click on a face of another model to snap the first model to it.

Sorry for the long pull request
update.title: GUI Align and Snap tools

content.raw: I noticed that the alignment tool doesn't take into account re-scaled objects. For example, place two boxes, then resize one of them to be bigger in every dimension. Then if you hover over the alignment options, there will be no difference between the three alignment options for each axis.
content.html: I noticed that the alignment tool doesn't take into account re-scaled objects. For example, place two boxes, then resize one of them to be bigger in every dimension. Then if you hover over the alignment options, there will be no difference between the three alignment options for each axis.

content.raw: The ghost visual looks great!
content.html: The ghost visual looks great!
